https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/biolo._instruction: Add the biological sex of all specimen in this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/biolo.description: Differentiation of individuals of most species (animals and plants) based on the type of gametes they produce.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/biolo.label: Biological sex
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/biolo.name: biologicalSex

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/genot._instruction: Add the genotype of all specimen in this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/genot.description: Genetic constitution of an individual or group.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/genot.label: Genotype
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/genot.name: genotype

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/inter._instruction: Enter the identifier of this specimen set that is used within the corresponding data.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/inter.description: Term or code that identifies someone or something within a particular product.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/inter.label: Internal identifier
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/inter.name: internalIdentifier

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/later._instruction: Add one or both hemisphere sides from which the tissue samples in this collection originate from.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/later.description: Differentiation between a pair of lateral homologous parts of the body.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/later.label: Laterality
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/later.name: laterality

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/origi._instruction: Add the biogical origin (organ or cell type) of all tissue samples in this collection.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/origi.description: Source at which something begins or rises, or from which something derives.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/origi.label: Origin
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/origi.name: origin

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/pheno._instruction: Add the phenotype of all specimen in this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/pheno.description: Physical expression of one or more genes of an organism.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/pheno.label: Phenotype
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/pheno.name: phenotype

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/quant._instruction: Enter the number of specimen that belong to this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/quant.description: Total amount or number of things or beings.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/quant.label: Quantity
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/quant.name: quantity

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/speci._instruction: Add the species of all specimen in this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/speci.description: Category of biological classification comprising related organisms or populations potentially capable of interbreeding, and being designated by a binomial that consists of the name of a genus followed by a Latin or latinized uncapitalized noun or adjective.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/speci.label: Species
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/speci.name: species

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/strai._instruction: Add the strain of all specimen in this set.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/strai.description: Group of presumed common ancestry with physiological but usually not morphological distinctions.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/strai.label: Strain
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/strai.name: strain

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/studi._instruction: Add all states in which this tissue sample collection was studied.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/studi.description: Reference to a point in time at which something or someone was studied in a particular mode or condition.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/studi.label: Studied state
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/studi.name: studiedState

https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/type._instruction: Add the type of all tissue samples in this collection.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/type.description: Distinct class to which a group of entities or concepts with similar characteristics or attributes belong to.
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/type.label: Type
https://openminds.ebrains.eu/vocab/type.name: type
